intro: Bryodesma cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-gray bryodesma, is a species of liverwort found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Pottiaceae and is characterized by its small, closely packed leaves that are typically grayish in color. The plant lacks true roots and instead relies on rhizoids for anchorage and nutrient absorption. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short stalks and release spores when mature. Bryodesma cinerascens is often found growing on rocks or soil in temperate regions, contributing to the biodiversity of moss and liverwort communities.
